fields.name: alt_id_Ending_Display_Script_Guide
fields.fieldText:
Alternate ID Uploads

Question: Do you have any proof of residency in the burn area that youd be willing to provide upfront? Acceptable documents include a utility bill, valid drivers license, etc.

Important Note: Providing an alternate ID is NOT required. If the client is able and willing to share a proof of residency document, follow the steps below to upload it. Otherwise, proceed with the screen flow.


Alternate ID Upload Instructions

  1. Request Upload Link:
    • Click the "Request Proof of ID" button in the top right of the client file.
    • Follow the on-screen prompts to send the upload link via SMS or Email.
  1. Locate the Uploaded Document:
  • Once the client uploads their document, access it here:
    • Proof of Residency Folder
  1. Save & Upload the Document:
    • Download the clients specific document to your computer.
    • Open the clients file and go to the "Documents" tab.
    • Drag and drop the downloaded document into this tab. It should upload automatically.
  1. Finalize the Upload:
    • Add a description: Proof of Client Residency
    • Verify the document appears in the clients file.

Delete the file from your computer once you confirm the upload.

screens.description: Used to navigate decisions post signature and provide any scripting as needed
screens.name: Post_Signature_Review
screens.label: Post Signature Review

fields.name: Post_Signature_Display_Text_Living
fields.fieldText:
-- Signature Has Been Sent --

Make sure it has been signed before continuing

-- Signing Document Guidance Script --

Great! Now that we have gone through our first set of questions, Ill walk you through our retainer agreement to ensure everything is clear before signing the document. Once weve completed the signature portion, well move on to the next set of questions to continue the intake process.


Explaining the Retainer Agreement:

The very first page of the paperwork is our retainer agreement. It basically states that we'll evaluate your case for free, and if we are not successful in recovering funds for you, you won't have to pay for our time or expenses. You will owe us nothing.


But if we do win, you'll get 70% of the settlement and the other 30% will go to our firm for our legal services. I also wanted to give you a rundown on some of the potential other costs you might encounter when pursuing any type of case, like court and filing costs, postage, photocopy, as well as retrieving medical records. In the event of a successful resolution, you agree to pay our firms a contingency fee equal to 30% of the value of your recovery, before all client expenses; which will have been advanced by us. Again though, we pay these fees on your behalf and only recover them if we achieve a successful outcome for you, so were taking all the risk and will work our hardest to get a good result for you. Do you have any questions about the agreement? 

Then, you will see a HIPAA release form, this is just a medical release form we will send to your hospital to get information regarding this claim specifically and verify the information we just went over today.

To enhance your understanding of the paperwork, I'll connect you to a brief 2-minute recording from our Managing Attorney, Shannon Overcash. I will come back on the line when the recording is over.

fields.name: Post_Signature_Display_Text_Death
fields.fieldText:
-- Signature Has Been Sent --

Make sure it has been signed before continuing

-- Signing Document Guidance Script --

Great! Now that we have gone through our first set of questions, Ill walk you through our retainer agreement to ensure everything is clear before signing the document. Once weve completed the signature portion, well move on to the next set of questions to continue the intake process.


Explaining the Retainer Agreement:

The very first page of the paperwork is our retainer agreement. It basically states that we'll evaluate your case for free, and if we are not successful in recovering funds for you, you won't have to pay for our time or expenses. You will owe us nothing.


But if we do win, you'll get 75% of the settlement and the other 25% will go to our firm for our legal services. I also wanted to give you a rundown on some of the potential other costs you might encounter when pursuing any type of case, like court and filing costs, postage, photocopy, as well as retrieving medical records. In the event of a successful resolution, you agree to pay our firms a contingency fee equal to 25% of the value of your recovery, before all client expenses; which will have been advanced by us. Again though, we pay these fees on your behalf and only recover them if we achieve a successful outcome for you, so were taking all the risk and will work our hardest to get a good result for you. Do you have any questions about the agreement? 

Then, you will see a HIPAA release form, this is just a medical release form we will send to your hospital to get information regarding this claim specifically and verify the information we just went over today.

To enhance your understanding of the paperwork, I'll connect you to a brief 2-minute recording from our Managing Attorney, Shannon Overcash. I will come back on the line when the recording is over.

fields.name: Post_Signature_Script
fields.fieldText: [Script Place Holder]

fields.name: Add_Resident_Display_PS_Script
fields.fieldText:
-- Collect Extra Resident Information --

PRIORITY -- Complete this before Warm Transfer

"We want to make sure the Law Firm is able to take care of everyone affected by the fire from your household."

"We need to quickly collect some information on each person and we will continue the final questions that will help the law firm process your case."

fields.name: High_Priority_Display_PS_Script
fields.fieldText:
-- High Priority Warm Transfer Script --

Warm Transfers to Partner Firm:

I have received your signed retainer agreement, and everything looks great! Ill now transfer you to our partner firm who will go through some more questions with you and discuss the next steps of your potential case. Do you have any questions before I transfer you to the firm? 

Please stay on the line for a few minutes while I get you transferred. Thanks!


When we connect with an A&T representative, please provide them with:

  • Caller name
  • Client name
  • Injury (death case via physical injury or commercial property loss)

fields.name: Long_Form_PS_Display_Script
fields.fieldText:
Long Form

If you are a Setter, please transfer to an available Closer to continue the process if applicable.


"We will now continue filling out the final information to help the Law Firm process your case."

fields.name: Add_Resident_Display_Text
fields.fieldText:
-- Add Resident --

This is Resident Number {!ResidentCreationCount} out of .

fields.name: Loop_Resident_First_Name
fields.fieldText: What is the person's first name?

fields.name: Loop_Resident_Last_Name
fields.fieldText: What is the person's last name?

fields.name: Loop_Resident_Middle_Name
fields.fieldText: Are you able to provide their middle name? (get it if you can)

fields.name: Loop_Resident_Suffix
fields.fieldText: Do they have a suffix? (get it if you can, N/A otherwise)

fields.name: Loop_Resident_Age
fields.fieldText: What is this person's age?

value.stringValue: What is the best phone number to reach them at?
Do you know what the best email to reach them is? (Optional, but important if you can get it)

textTemplates.name: High_Priority_Email
textTemplates.text:
Hi Everyone,


We have a high-value case coming your way shortly. Please be ready for a live transfer in the next few minutes.


Client information:

Caller Name: {!Get_Client_Record.Name}

Client Name: {!Get_Client_Record.Name}


CQC Outputs:

-- Coming Soon --
